alert.note: Alert for Fairfield (Connecticut) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS New York City - Upton (Long Island and New York City)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 18 at 6:11AM EST by NWS New York City - Upton
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 915 AM EST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Urban area and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is occurring. * WHERE...Portions of southern Connecticut, including the following counties, Fairfield and New Haven and southeast New York, including the following counties, Putnam and Westchester. * WHEN...Until 915 AM EST. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Streams continue to rise due to excess runoff from earlier rainfall. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 610 AM EST, emergency management reported flooding in the warned area in the area of Danbury. Flooding is already occurring. Between 1 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Bridgeport, New Haven, Stamford, Waterbury, Norwalk, Danbury, White Plains, Milford, Shelton, Naugatuck, Southbury, New Canaan, Wolcott, Mount Kisco, Mahopac, Lake Carmel, Sherman, Brewster, Newtown and Fairfield. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
